aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: defaultAdminShell

Aspect Model for the Quality Management business case describing an 8D report. An 8D report (Eight Disciplines) is a structured problem-solving method used primarily in quality management to identify, correct, and eliminate recurring issues. It guides teams through eight steps, including root cause analysis and implementation of permanent corrective actions. The goal is to improve processes, prevent future problems, and ensure customer satisfaction.
The header of the 8D Report
The Contact of the customer

Aspect Model for the Quality Management business case describing an 8D report. An 8D report (Eight Disciplines) is a structured problem-solving method used primarily in quality management to identify, correct, and eliminate recurring issues. It guides teams through eight steps, including root cause analysis and implementation of permanent corrective actions. The goal is to improve processes, prevent future problems, and ensure customer satisfaction.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Aspect Model for the Quality Management business case describing an 8D report. An 8D report (Eight Disciplines) is a structured problem-solving method used primarily in quality management to identify, correct, and eliminate recurring issues. It guides teams through eight steps, including root cause analysis and implementation of permanent corrective actions. The goal is to improve processes, prevent future problems, and ensure customer satisfaction.
The date of claim is the specific date on which the claim was filed.
The date of last revision refers to the most recent date on which the document was updated.
The title of the 8D report is the official title given to the 8D report.
The customer specific ID of the complaint process is the identifier assigned to the complaint process by the customer.
The supplier specific ID of the complaint process is the identifier assigned to the complaint process by the supplier.
The name of the buyer company is the official registered name of the buyer's business.
The street of the contact refers to the street address where the contact's business is located.
The location of the contact indicates the city or town where the contact operates.
The postal code of the contact is the ZIP or postal code for the contact's address.
The country of the contact specifies the nation where the contact's business is based.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Business Partner Number Legal Entity Property

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Business Partner Number Legal Entity Property

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Property based on a BPNL.
An email address.
Phone number with country and area code.
The Contact of the customer
The Contact of the supplier
The part number of the supplier is the identifier assigned to the part by the supplier.
The part number of the customer is the identifier assigned to the part by the customer.
The order number of the part is the number associated with the purchase order for the part.

Serial number of one specific part. A serial number is unique within one company. If you combine serial number with BPNL of that company than you get a unique identifier for this part in this data-space.
A batch number describes all parts that were manufactured in the same run.
The name of a part. A part name is not unique - same kinds of parts can have the same part name.
The hardware version of this part.
A unique part identifier in this data-space. Property is optional as of now not all parts have this identifier.
Information about the effected parts
Defines the location of the complaint

A unique identifier for one supplier inside data provider's company. If you combine supplier ID with BPNL of data provider you get a unique identifier for this supplier in this data space. As an alternative you can use BPNL to identify a supplier.
The name of one supplier company.
A unique quality task identifier within this data-space.
Key identifier for this additional information
Value for this additional information
You can use this key:value list for additional properties that were not defined in this aspect model.
The header of the 8D Report
The name of the person working on the 8D-report
The department of the person working on the 8D-report
The role in the company of the person working on the 8D-report
Sponsor of the 8D Report
team leader
contact person
Team members
First step of the 8D Report. Containing information about the team members working on the root cause analysis
Describes which symptoms lead to the claim
Describes the problem of the complaint and the consequences that arise from it
Describes the error type to be classified
Describes at what point the risk assessment was started - the date as yyyy-mm-dd
Describes at what point the risk assessment was updated - the date as yyyy-mm-dd
Allows to link an quality task attachment with added information about the complaint e.g. dimensions, photos, production data,….
Describes at which component or location the error occurred
Second step of the 8D Report.
Explain how the effectiveness of this measure has been validated
Explain to which extend / percentage the measure is effective
Definition of the date of introduction of the immediate measures - the date as yyyy-mm-dd
Person responsible for the implementation of the planned corrective measure
Describes the risk of introduction an immediate measure
Describes the method for testing and demonstrating effectiveness
Describes interim containment action to resolve the quality problem in the short term
Third step of the 8D Report
There are different types of causes which are defined in 4 different categories.
Describes the causal hypothesis
Name the person responsible for investigating the hypothesis
Determination of the date of clarification of the cause - the date as yyyy-mm-dd
The result describes the outcome of a causal hypothesis
Describes the method for forming the causal hypothesis
Describes in detail the result of the investigated root cause hypothesis
Describes the error cause category (ID) according to the VDA error catalog
Describes and lists the root cause(s)
Fourth Step of the 8D Report
Define for which root cause the measure is relevant
Implementation status
Plan technical measure to resolve the quality problem permanently
Describes and lists planned permanent corrective measure(s)
Fifth step of the 8D Report
A List of implemented corrective measures
Sixth step of the 8D Report
Describes and lists error preventive measure(s)
Seventh step of the 8D Report
Allows a summary of the measure and a final statement on its effectiveness
Determining the time of 8D completion
Eighth step of the 8D Report
Describes and lists planned permanent corrective measure(s)
Optional Step D0 used for the Global 8D Standard
